result.execSummary:
The defendant Nakesha M Zaruba was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Identity Theft- Avoidance [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.201(2)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Notice of Completion of Representation
Probation Revoked - Sentenced to Time Served on 08/25/2022

2:30 PM cases 21CF70, 21CF1160, 21CF1358, 22CF42, 22CF610 called. Defendant Nakesha M Zaruba in court, in custody.  Attorney Lester Liptak in court for Nakesha M Zaruba.  Prosecuting attorney Matthew Z Kirkpatrick in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney William Schembera in court for Nakesha M Zaruba on 22CF610. 
No corrections to the revocation packet from the Defense. Court questions parties regarding the agreement in 22CF610. 
Court does not agree with the agreement the parties are proposing. 
In 22CF610: Defendant waives reading of Information (not filed) and enters Not Guilty pleas- Received by the Court. 
State notes the Information will mirror the criminal complaint. 
Parties discuss Chippewa County cases where defendant was recently sentenced. 
Defendant makes a statement regarding how she can be successful on Probation. 
Defense notes there is no restitution owed on the cases being revoked. 

In revoked files Court orders: 
In 21CF70 Count 1: 6 months in Jail with 156 days credit. 
In 21CF1160 Count 1: 6 months in Jail with 156 days credit. 
In 21CF1160 Count 5: 4 months in Jail with 156 days credit. 
In 21CF1358 Count 1: 4 months in Jail with 156 days credit. 
In 22CF42 Count 2: 6 months in Jail with 222 days credit. 
All sentences run concurrent to one another and any other sentence currently being served. 

In 22CF610: Defendant is advised of charges, maximum penalties, elements of the crime(s) and constitutional rights. 
Defendant pleads Guilty to count 1 Possession with Intent to Deliver (2nd+, Repeater), Count 4 Resisting an Officer and count 5 Carrying a Concealed Knife. 
Court accepts plea, finds the defendant Guilty. Anything else is dismissed and read in. 
As to Counts 4 and 5: Defendant ordered to pay court costs including applicable surcharges and provide a DNA sample. 
As to count 1: 
Court Imposes but Stays 3 years to the Department of Corrections: 18 months Initial Confinement followed by 18 months Extended supervision. 
Defendant is placed on Probation for 3 years with conditions: 
Maintain absolute sobriety. Any conditions, programming or treatment per the agent and follow through with recommendations. 
No contact with any known drug dealers/users except in a therapeutic setting. 
Defendant not to consume/use/possess any illegal drugs/non-prescribed medications/controlled substances or drug paraphernalia. 
Defendant to pay court costs including applicable surcharges. Conditions of extended supervision, if revoked are the same. 
Defendant eligible for CIP and SAP. If defendant is successful on Probation in 22CF610 court will expunge from defendant's record. 
Defendant has 91 days sentence credit if revoked from Probation.
Status conference on August 25, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Status conference on September 21, 2022 at 08:45 am.

8:54 AM Cases called: 21CF1160, 21CF1358 & 22CF42. Defendant Nakesha M Zaruba in court, in custody.  Attorney Lester H Liptak in court for Nakesha M Zaruba. District Attorney Peter Rindal appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant has another open case. Parties would like to reschedule this to hopefully resolve them all together. There is also 21CF70 that is a SEHR in Br. 1. Court is agreeable to handling all defendant's cases.

IT IS ORDERED: this case is transferred to Branch 5 while defendant is a participant in the Treatment Court program.  The case will be administratively reassigned back to the initial court upon defendant's successful completion of the Eau Claire County Treatment Court Program, or upon defendant's termination from that program.
Reminder Notice regarding court costs amount routed to Defendant in the jail

(Cases called at 1:34 PM - 21CF1120, 21CF1160, 21CF1358, 22CF42) Judge Theisen for Branch 1.
Defendant Nakesha Zaruba appears in custody with Attorney Alicia Linzmeier.  District Attorney Peter Rindal appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense has reviewed the Informations in all cases and waives the reading.  Defense outlines agreement for the Court.  State in compliance with victim notification requirements.  Defendant advised of the elements and maximum possible penalties of the offenses to which she will plea. Defendant pleads No Contest to 21CF1160 Count 1: Drive or Operate a Vehicle without the Owner's Consent (Repeater), Count 5: Possession of Methamphetamine (Repeater); 21CF1358 Count 1: Possession of Methamphetamine (Repeater); and 22CF42 Count 2: Identity Theft - Avoidance (Repeater).  Court accepts pleas and finds Defendant guilty of the charges to which she has pled.  Remaining charges, as well as all of 21CF1120, are dismissed and read in (along with 21TR8656 and 21TR8657).  Court withholds sentence and orders 36 months of probation with the following conditions:  9 months jail (on 21CF1160 Count 1), last 8 months stayed pending compliance with treatment court.  Participate in and successfully complete drug treatment court program.  Undergo AODA assessment.  Comply with any conditions/programming/assessments per agent.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  Provide DNA sample and pay fee.  No contact with D.G., C.P., K.B., J.W., or any known drug dealers/users except in a therapeutic setting.  No contact with K.S. unless she and the agent approve in writing.  68 days sentence credit on 22CF42 if revoked from probation; 2 days credit in each 21CF1160 and 21CF1358 if revoked from probation.
Elements of the Offense - Identity Theft
Plea Offer
Renumbering from counts 6 and 7 to counts 1 and 2.
Arraignment on March 17, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

9:54 AM cases 21CF1120, 21CF1160, 21CF1358 and 22CF42 called and held via Zoom. Prosecuting attorney Matthew Z Kirkpatrick appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Nakesha M Zaruba appeared by video, in custody from the Eau Claire Jail, Attorney Alicia Linzmeier appeared in court for Nakesha M Zaruba. In all files: Defendant waives right to appear in person and Court accepts waiver. 
In all files: Defendant waives right to a preliminary hearing and Court accepts waiver. 
In 22CF42: Defense requests a bond modification with argument. Victim C.P. makes a statement. State opposes any changes to the bond modification. Defense makes argument. 
Court denies bond modification. 
All files sent to Branch 1 to schedule an ARGN.
